# **attach_invoice_schedule**
> CommonResponse attach_invoice_schedule(schedule_key, attach_invoice_schedule_request, accept_encoding=accept_encoding, content_encoding=content_encoding, authorization=authorization, zuora_track_id=zuora_track_id, zuora_entity_ids=zuora_entity_ids, zuora_version=zuora_version, zuora_org_ids=zuora_org_ids)

Attach an invoice schedule

Attach charges to an invoice schedule. You can attach charges to the invoice schedule if they were detached from the Invoice Schedule.  After the charges are attached to the invoice schedule, they can be automatically executed by Zuora Scheduler  or by the [Execute an invoice schedule](https://www.zuora.com/developer/api-references/api/operation/Post_ExecuteInvoiceSchedule/) API operation. 

### Example

* Bearer Authentication (bearerAuth):

# **create_invoice_schedule**
> InvoiceScheduleResponse create_invoice_schedule(request, idempotency_key=idempotency_key, accept_encoding=accept_encoding, content_encoding=content_encoding, authorization=authorization, zuora_track_id=zuora_track_id, zuora_entity_ids=zuora_entity_ids, zuora_version=zuora_version, zuora_org_ids=zuora_org_ids)

Create an invoice schedule

Creates an invoice schedule.  ### Limitations  This API operation has the following limitations: * You can create at most 50 invoice schedule items in one request. * You can associate at most 10 orders with an invoice schedule in one request. * You can associate at most 300 subscriptions with an invoice schedule in one request, including those contained in orders and separate subscriptions.

# **delete_invoice_schedule**
> CommonResponse delete_invoice_schedule(schedule_key, accept_encoding=accept_encoding, content_encoding=content_encoding, authorization=authorization, zuora_track_id=zuora_track_id, zuora_entity_ids=zuora_entity_ids, zuora_version=zuora_version, zuora_org_ids=zuora_org_ids)

Delete an invoice schedule

Deletes an invoice schedule in Pending status. The status of the invoice schedule to be deleted must be `Pending`. 

### Example

* Bearer Authentication (bearerAuth):

# **detach_invoice_schedule**
> CommonResponse detach_invoice_schedule(schedule_key, detach_invoice_schedule_request, accept_encoding=accept_encoding, content_encoding=content_encoding, authorization=authorization, zuora_track_id=zuora_track_id, zuora_entity_ids=zuora_entity_ids, zuora_version=zuora_version, zuora_org_ids=zuora_org_ids)

Detach an invoice schedule

Detach charges from an invoice schedule. After the charges detached from invoice schedule, they cannot be automatically executed by Zuora Scheduler or by the [Execute an invoice schedule](https://www.zuora.com/developer/api-references/api/operation/Post_ExecuteInvoiceSchedule/) API operation.

# **execute_invoice_schedule**
> BillRunResponse execute_invoice_schedule(schedule_key, request, idempotency_key=idempotency_key, accept_encoding=accept_encoding, content_encoding=content_encoding, authorization=authorization, zuora_track_id=zuora_track_id, zuora_entity_ids=zuora_entity_ids, zuora_version=zuora_version, zuora_org_ids=zuora_org_ids)

Execute an invoice schedule

Executes an invoice schedule immediately.  During the execution, a bill run is created and generates an invoice or a credit memo asynchronously. nWhen you use this API operation to execute an invoice schedule item, you have the flexibility to decide whether to specify a specific item ID.  - If you specify the unique ID of an invoice schedule item to be executed in the request, the corresponding invoice schedule item is executed. - If you do not specify the ID of any invoice schedule item in the request, the subscription end date is used as the target date to determine the next pending schedule item to be executed.   For more samples, see [Execute invoice schedules](https://knowledgecenter.zuora.com/Billing/Billing_and_Payments/Billing_Schedule/Billing_Schedule_tutorials/Execute_invoice_schedules).

* Bearer Authentication (bearerAuth):

# **get_invoice_schedule**
> InvoiceScheduleResponse get_invoice_schedule(schedule_key, accept_encoding=accept_encoding, content_encoding=content_encoding, authorization=authorization, zuora_track_id=zuora_track_id, zuora_entity_ids=zuora_entity_ids, zuora_version=zuora_version, zuora_org_ids=zuora_org_ids)

Retrieve an invoice schedule

Retrieves detailed information about an invoice schedule.

# **pause_invoice_schedule**
> InvoiceScheduleResponse pause_invoice_schedule(schedule_key, accept_encoding=accept_encoding, content_encoding=content_encoding, authorization=authorization, zuora_track_id=zuora_track_id, zuora_entity_ids=zuora_entity_ids, zuora_version=zuora_version, zuora_org_ids=zuora_org_ids)

Pause an invoice schedule

Pauses an invoice schedule immediately.  After one invoice schedule is paused, it cannot be automatically executed by Zuora Scheduler or by the [Execute an invoice schedule](https://www.zuora.com/developer/api-references/api/operation/Post_ExecuteInvoiceSchedule/) API operation.  If you want to run a paused invoice schedule, you can create a bill run with the target date greater than the next run date of the invoice schedule. 

### Example

* Bearer Authentication (bearerAuth):

# **resume_invoice_schedule**
> InvoiceScheduleResponse resume_invoice_schedule(schedule_key, accept_encoding=accept_encoding, content_encoding=content_encoding, authorization=authorization, zuora_track_id=zuora_track_id, zuora_entity_ids=zuora_entity_ids, zuora_version=zuora_version, zuora_org_ids=zuora_org_ids)

Resume an invoice schedule

Resumes an invoice schedule in Paused status immediately.  After an invoice schedule is resumed, it can continue to be automatically executed by Zuora Scheduler or by the [Execute an invoice schedule](https://www.zuora.com/developer/api-references/api/operation/Post_ExecuteInvoiceSchedule/) API operation.

# **update_invoice_schedule**
> InvoiceScheduleResponse update_invoice_schedule(schedule_key, request, accept_encoding=accept_encoding, content_encoding=content_encoding, authorization=authorization, zuora_track_id=zuora_track_id, zuora_entity_ids=zuora_entity_ids, zuora_version=zuora_version, zuora_org_ids=zuora_org_ids)

Update an invoice schedule

Updates a pending invoice schedule.  You can use this API operation to update invoice schedules in the following aspects: - Update notes and pending invoice schedule items - Update orders associated with invoice schedules - Remove or add invoice schedule items  For more samples, see [Edit invoice schedules](https://knowledgecenter.zuora.com/Billing/Billing_and_Payments/Billing_Schedule/Billing_Schedule_tutorials/Edit_invoice_schedules). n### Restrictions and limitations   When updating invoice schedules through the REST API, keep the following restrictions and limitations in mind: - You can only update invoice schedule items in Pending status. - You can only add orders or specific subscriptions to pending invoice schedules, and remove orders or specific subscriptions from pending invoice schedules. - For the invoice schedule items that you want to update, you must include the new values for these items in the request. - For the invoice schedule items that you want to keep unchanged, you must include all the existing information about these items in the request. Otherwise, the existing invoice schedule items that you do not mention in the request are deleted. - For the orders that you want to keep unchanged for an invoice schedule, you must include all the existing order numbers associated with the invoice schedule in the request. Otherwise, the existing orders that you do not mention in the request are removed.
